column4: It seems to think that it was a failed password when I look at the /var/log/auth.log
..even though a failed password would not show that message
I'm trying to add shell accounts. I'd rather not mix it with gdm.

su - conglomo and "ssh conglomo@localhost" all fail with the password expired message and then it says password failed. (which is the odd part, wrong password does not show the password expired message).
well of course it won't if the password is wrong then it's not expired
The problem I'm having is, when a password is expired, the user is no longer prompted to change it, instead it says that it's expired and doesn't let them proceed to change it.
In the previous version of ubuntu that I was running, this wasn't an issue. I could "useradd", set a temp password, and expire it.
The user would be immediately prompted to change it and they could go happily on their way.
hang on looks like it's an issue not with just Ubuntu
you need to edit /etc/pam.d/login and add this line password required pam_stack.so service=system-auth
also might need to add that to /etc/pam.d/sshd as well
PAM unable to dlopen(/lib/security/pam_stack.so): /lib/security/pam_stack.so: cannot open shared object
ok remove those lines and guess Ubuntu actually removed that
